The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish in color, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Glossaspis tentaculata is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields due to its adaptability and rapid growth. It is considered an invasive species in some regions, where it can outcompete native vegetation.
